children.subject:
Not an answer but some info:

- Math 170 teaches mostly Linear Programming (80% of the time), which is not mostly used in industry now. The textbook is written a long long time ago.

history.content:
Can someone who has taken CS classes by math department tell me more about what they're like and how are they differ from CS classes by EECS department?

For example, personally i enjoy math54 more than ee16a because even though it's cool to learn linear algebra in a practical point of view, i appreciate learning the theory more. 

I'm interested in hearing more about experience with math116 (cryptography) / math118 (Fourier analysis, wavelets, and signal processing) / math136 (Incompleteness and Undecidability) / math170 (mathematical methods for optimization). 

In addition, I'm also wondering whether those math classes prepare students well to become successful computer scientists (compare to their counterparts by eecs department). 

Any related insights would be helpful as well! Thanks : )
history.subject: CS classes by math department
